net.fognode.request.api

Interface Request

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleRequest

    public interface Request
    A generic protocol-independent request, used by the gateway internally. A Request object is created on the ingoing edge of the gateway, for every ingoing request to the user-defined API. The Request object should be created by a RequestFactory (@see net.fognode.request.api.RequestFactory). At the outgoing edge, a specific client handling the request's protocol (e.g. HTTP) creates a request based on the Request object's properties. In between both edges, middleware can read and manipulate those properties.
    Author:
    Ludwig Muench

    • Method Detail

      • getProtocol

        java.lang.String getProtocol()
        Protocol (e.g. "HTTP") getter.
        Returns:
        the request's protocol

      • getMethod

        java.lang.String getMethod()
        Method (e.g. "POST") getter.
        Returns:
        the request's method

      • getLocation

        java.lang.String getLocation()
        Location getter. The location is only the path of a REST resource of the user-defined API, which was called (e.g. "/humidity/1") and has triggered the creation of the current request.
        Returns:
        the request's location

      • getResourceLocation

        java.lang.String getResourceLocation()
        Resource location getter. The resource location is the complete URL (e.g. "http://127.0.0.1:5000/humid1") of the targeted resource, as it was registered in the Resource Directory when the mapping was created. The client (@see net.fognode.client.api.Client) at the outgoing edge of the gateway will send a protocol-specific request to this URL.
        Returns:
        the request's location

      • setResourceLocation

        void setResourceLocation(java.lang.String resourceLocation)
        Resource location setter.
        Parameters:
        resourceLocation - the resource location

      • getPayload

        java.lang.Object getPayload()
        Payload (e.g. HTTP request body) getter.
        Returns:
        the request's payload

      • setPayload

        void setPayload(java.lang.Object payload)
        Payload setter.
        Parameters:
        payload - the request's payload
